meanings.definition: To slip or fall out of place
meanings.sent1: The bookshelf started to prolapse under the weight of the heavy books.
meanings.sent2: I watched the loose shoelace prolapse from the shoe as I walked.
meanings.sent3: The cake batter seemed to prolapse over the edge of the mixing bowl.
meanings.sent4: Her smile prolapsed into a frown when she heard the bad news.
meanings.sent5: The balloon slowly prolapsed downward as the air escaped.

meanings.definition: The slipping or falling out of place of an organ or part of the body
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed her with a bladder prolapse after the examination.
meanings.sent2: He felt a sudden prolapse of his knee joint during the game.
meanings.sent3: The garden hose had a funny prolapse when it slipped off the hook.
meanings.sent4: The landslide caused a prolapse of rocks down the mountainside.
meanings.sent5: The tree root's prolapse from the ground was a sign of instability.
